page.title: 03BUILDINGS IN OVERY
page.content: Overy has an old School. It is not used as a school now but is used as a Village Hall and people rent it for parties and games. Most houses are quite old. Overy has three shops of which two sell beach wear. Their names are The Boathouse and The Overy Maritime Stores. Overy has one pub owned by Mr. and Mrs. Conway and it is called The Hero. In Overy there are two farms, one is owned by Mr. and Mrs. Smith and the other is owned by Mrs. Wroth. In Overy there used to be a hotel called the Moorings but now it is a house for three families. Overy has got only one grocers which sells food, cans and bottles. There is one sub-Post Office in Gong Lane. Farther on is a double playing field which has some swings and one slide.
